meanings.definition: A person or thing that succeeds or follows
meanings.sent1: My grandfather's successors in the family business are his children.
meanings.sent2: The new CEO's successors will be chosen based on their leadership skills.
meanings.sent3: The cat's successors, her kittens, were causing mischief in the house.
meanings.sent4: The student council president's successors will have big shoes to fill.
meanings.sent5: The queen bee's successors must be ready to take on the responsibilities of the hive.

meanings.sent1: The prince was the king's designated successors to the throne.
meanings.sent2: In the animal kingdom, the lion's successors are usually his cubs.
meanings.sent3: The chef's successors, his apprentices, were eager to learn his secret recipes.
meanings.sent4: The author's successors continued his legacy by writing in the same genre.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's successors, her former students, were now successful professionals.
